edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter

Class Affordance

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Action
      • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Affordance
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionInterface, java.lang.Comparable<ActionInterface>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SWAffordance

    public abstract class Affordance
extends Action
    Base class for simulator affordances

    Affordances are Actions that can be performed on an Entity. For example, An Entity with an Attack Affordance can be attacked.

    Generated by UML Lab.

    Author:
    ram
    See Also:
    edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Action}, edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Entity}

    • Constructor Detail

      • Affordance

        public Affordance(EntityInterface theTarget,
                  MessageRenderer m)
        Parameterized constructor for Affordance. Descendant classes should call this constructor explicitly to set the target, as the default constructor is declared private.
        Parameters:
        theTarget - Entity that has the Affordance
        m - MessageRenderer to allow the Affordance to display messages
